title: Toplaners low elo player struggle to fight?
body: So for the purpose of being able to counter these picks when I come across them, or just plain out abuse them myself, excluding higher skill cap champions like Riven and Yasuo. In your opinions what are some underrated top laner champions that low elo players have no clue how to deal with, or just have a really hard time to lane against? and how do you deal with those champions?

replies.body:
My least favourite toplane to face is tryndamere.

Playing laning phase is constant pressure to try to make sure he can't free farm, he doesn't get a tp down to botlane post 6, keeping track of how much burst damage he has to make sure I'm not out of position the tiniest bit, and that he's not going to zone me out post6. And if I do die to him, next time I come back to lane he's going to towerdive me and turn me to mincemeat and then take my tower, and if I get help from the jungle he just 2v1's us whilst we're waiting for his ult to expire, and from there he just snowballs out of control. And if by some miracle or early gank, I do win lane, eventually we start teamfighting for objectives, but he'll just mindlessly splitpush and possibly go 0-12, but he'll still draw our team to stop him and push at least 2 lanes down to their inhibitors and farm up to the point where he'll still manage to kill my out of position adc before inevitably going down.
so who would be a good counter pick for tryndamere? in that case, I actually play tryndamere already since he's so good at pushing towers

hmm I'd say if I had to counterpick, 
- I'd go teemo or jax for obvious reasons the dodge/blind shuts down trynd's damage and these champs can splitpush against trynd lategame too, 
- sion because the ranges of sion's abilities just seem to work well against tryndamere but eventually you get outscaled and so splitpushing becomes a problem because after a while you can't fight trynd anymore so you need a coordinated team which will listen when you ping objectives,
- garen because it's garen and you'll outduel trynd for most the game thanks to the silence and movespeed shutting down trynd's escapes and chase, allowing garen safety in these fights and making it more risky for the tryndamere,
- and ap shaco top because it's hard for tryndamere to kill shaco however splitpushing becomes a problem.

These are good, though garen takes a bit of judgmment,and a variant build path.


Nasus is also very solid, trynd does nothing with wither on him, by the time he gets qss he usually cant stop Nasus.  Nasus outpushes, outduels and outteamfights him come midgame.
don't go teemo against tryn haha youll get stomped the best counter I think is akali as  someone who has played a lot of tryn

Poppy is a good counter. Her W blocks his Q and if tries to dive and ult you, just ult him back.

In fact it's pretty hard to lose lane as Poppy at the moment, but she's not the most effective tank in team fights.

Illaoi is one of them, due to her tentacles.
Tryndamere, due to his crit damage and his ult.
Nasus, if you allow him to farm and let him get a few stacks by not constantly poking him, and he will be very hard to fight against afterwards, and he could outtrade you.
statistically nasus usually gets destroyed in the laning phase and doesn't get to fulfil his stack dream in the majority of games, leading to his very low winrate in bronze and silver.
One problem with your theory.  He actually doesnt have a low winrate in silver and bronze.

except last I checked (which was when I made my post) on average across regions he had like a 48% winrate in bronze and a 47% winrate in silver, which only gets worse as you go up the ladder. (I think those winrates have gone up by 1%, but nasus is still below average, and usually only wins games that go past 30min).

I don't like nasus because he's useless when behind since he's not inherently very tanky (compared to true tanks or sustain tanks), his damage without stacks is poor, he has no peel, lockdown or engage, his poke is bad, he has no mobility (yes stormraiders and ghost, but that only counts if he's ahead) and his utility is low. He's also not too hard to counterpick, and interestingly when the enemy team has a zilean, his winrate drops by around 10%.
Darius, Garen, Jax, Teemo, Nasus, Kathus (when top). I even had a Le Blanc top who absolutely destroyed me.
Pantheon is cancer mate, teemo as well.
If you are good (i.e. know your damage limits and have map awareness), then Teemo is the ultimate troll pick. Just watch TheRainMan's stream :)
I actually play Teemo support quite a bit, but I don't really know how to lane against top laners so i think i'll steer clear of him until i learn how to play against some popular top lane picks :(

Im suprised no one has said shaco.

A good shaco top is the definition of cancer no matter what champ you play
Illaoi, Trynd, Darius, Pantheon, Urogt (ofc he's so hard to lane against{{champion:122}} ) And TEEEMMMMMMMMOOOOOOOO
